instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
threads.message:
Howdy, I've got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no internal or external video. chimes with a solid sleep LED. <SIGNAL>ALL_GPU_GOOD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> present, gmux 3.3 1.2 and 1.8 rails all good, slp signals present.

someone already ran jumper wire to bklt pins on lvds, so recall is out of the question

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
threads.message:
There are no recalls on 3330 boards anyway.
If the sleep led stays on that could indicate <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is being held low, it needs to be high, check voltage there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> was the first thing I checked, it's present. strangely, if I close the lid, the LED will start breathing like it's in sleep mode, and when I open the lid, the LED turns off, but no video of course

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
threads.message: yes, prior person replaced LVDS and ran a jumper for bklt for some reason. thankfully the guy didn't clean anything off, so the area around the gpu was covered in dust and no liquid made it under the chip or even on that part of the board, only LVDS side. only darkened probe points are a few between the lvds connector and the fan connector

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
threads.message: Was the connector replace with the correct 2012 style connector?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
threads.message:
it's the one that is gold on the part that rests on the board, and silver on the top, unlike the earlier ones, so yeah, I think that's the right one.

on a side note, where do you find these connectors? I can only find the 2009-2011 ones, this is the second 2012 15" board I've ever seen

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
threads.message: I take them from donor boards. Did you check external video with the machine booted from a known good drive?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
threads.message: I'm getting no display on thunderbolt either, tried resettin gSMC and pram, all I get is chime but no video. all GPU rails look good and I'm basically lost at this point

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
threads.message: Is OSX fully booting? With HDMI adapter OSX needs to be booted for external to work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
threads.message:
with a usb drive, it looks like it's booting off it since the LED will blink for a while, but even plugged in for five minutes, it doesn't give me video. in target disk mode, the drives won't pick up on another mac either.

[edit] hmm, after ten or so minutes, it shits itself off as well. neat

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
threads.message: I really have no clues to give. The shutting down is not normal also. Are you checking external video without the LCD plugged in?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
threads.message: external with and without internal plugged in, can't get video at all. left it plugged in over night for shits and giggles and it was still on when I got to work this morning, so it's not shutting down at least. are the GPUs flakey in these like the 2011s?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
threads.message: These GPUs are not a known issue on these. You could enable remote login on the OS with a good machine and then boot this machine from that drive. You can then remotely login and see if the machine is booted and if the GPU is recognized.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no video
threads.message: I'm going to just throw in the towel with this one, thanks anyhow. I've got another one that isn't booting that I'll make a new thread for
